Job Description:

ole Summary/Purpose:
Billions of transactions—and you’ll touch all of them if you join our IT team as a API Software Development Engineer - I. Imagine the sheer scale of what we impact every second of every day. Now imagine what you can do with that influence—this is where you can shape the future of payments.

As a API Software Development Engineer - I, you’ll be a part of an amazing team working on our microservice API’s throughout the entire development process. You’ll participate in hack-a-thons, partner with universities on innovation events, and work with our famed Stamford Innovation Station

Billions of transactions and you’ll touch all of them if you join our IT team as API Software Development Engineer. Imagine the sheer scale of what we impact every second of every day. Now imagine what you can do with that influence. This is where you can shape the future of payments.

Title: AVP, Front End - .NET Web Application Developer - Pets Best
Job_Description:
Job Description:
About Pets Best
Pets Best was founded in 2005 and has been voted one of the Best Places to Work in Idaho five years in a row. We provide insurance coverage for dogs and cats and are the only veterinarian founded pet insurance agency in the United States. Recently we joined CareCredit, a Synchrony solution; and together we provide pet parents peace of mind and financial solutions for veterinary care when they need it most. Join our team of pet lovers who strive to treat our members and their pets like family by delivering the highest quality customer service and value.
Role Summary/Purpose:
Develops software applications and processes and web site functionality to support smooth business operations.

Title: VP, Source-to-Pay Global Customer Support / Project Management Leader
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
The Source-to-Pay (S2P) Customer Support / Project Management Leader role will be responsible for managing the project management (PMO), Communications and Training functions to support cross-functional teams across Source-to-Pay. This role will lead many cross-functional initiatives that will drive efficiencies and compliance while enhancing the customer experience. This role will have broad exposure across Procure-to-Pay, Sourcing, Supplier Management, Contracts Management, Finance, Information Security, Information Technology, Operations across Synchrony.
We’re proud to offer you choice and flexibility. You have the option to be remote, and work from home, or come into one of our offices. You may be occasionally requested to commute to our nearest office for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events.

Role Summary/Purpose
As a key member of the B2B Digital Products Team, this leadership role is responsible for helping drive and achieve Synchrony’s business objectives focusing on the Commercial credit products. The Digital Program Manager will be responsible for leading a set of Agile teams that deliver new features, capabilities and enhanced B2B experiences. The preferred candidate will demonstrate SYF’s ability to understand and meet our client’s and customer’s needs through technology-driven and innovative solutions in partnership with Technology, Credit and other Synchrony teams. Title: VP, Source-to-Pay Global Customer Support / Project Management Leader
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
This role focuses on end-to-end delivery of Regulatory, Tax and Controllership changes needed across business process, technology, and operations to meet the directives.
This role will collaborate with project stakeholders and Technology Agile teams to build high quality solutions. The ideal candidate will understand all aspects of the project lifecycle using an Agile methodology with focus on business analysis, root cause analysis, requirements definition and finalizing project scope, driving optimal solutions, project planning and execution including post-production validation to meet regulatory demands.
The candidate will need to successfully build relationships with the Technology and Strategy teams, their leadership team, and the various stakeholders throughout the organization.

Title: VP, Technical Cyber Intelligence Leader
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
The VP, Technical Cyber Intelligence Leader is responsible for leading the Cyber Intelligence program’s technical threat analysis team. The Team provides insights and control recommendations to key customers across Cyber Operations, Information Security, and additional business lines. The Leader is responsible for implementation of technical threat intelligence collection and analysis strategies and for prioritization and execution of day-to-day activities occurring within the Team. The Technical intelligence function provides deep technical threat insights supporting threat detection, control validation, and threat hunting operations and strategies, and consults on longer-term technical initiatives requiring consideration of potential technical threats and corresponding mitigations/controls. The ideal candidate will possess deep technical understanding of cyber intelligence tradecraft and cyber detection and incident response and have extensive intelligence briefing experience to all levels including executives, alongside demonstrated strong interpersonal and leadership skills.

Title: AVP, Principal Product Engineer – Servicing Apps
Job_Description:
Description:
Positions Overview
The Nanotronics Applications Engineer is a smart and passionate team member, who plays a direct role in the development of the world's most technologically advanced inspection and factory control solutions. This position is responsible for demonstrating the capabilities of Nanotronics’ instrumentation, and successful Applications Engineers are efficient at executing high-quality reports for prospective customers and especially reports that yield a high conversion rate of prospects to customers. Overarching goals are to provide customers with:
Test results that are highly specific to the customers’ needs and/or processes;
More significant test results in terms of precision, accuracy and repeatability;
Test results that relate to process and/or performance requirements of the customers’ products giving more information than current test methods or other competitive test methods; and

Description:
The Nanotronics Computer Vision Engineer in our AI Lab is a smart, creative and passionate engineer who will work with our team in the development of the world’s ultimate integrated manufacturing platform. This position will be responsible for building the most implemented supervision and training platform across multiple industries, such as hypercar manufacturing, semiconductor manufacturing and personalized medicine.
Requirements:

Education and Experience
3+ years or compensating advanced degree (PhD or Masters)

Title: AVP, Principal Product Engineer – Servicing Apps
Job_Description:
DataVisor is a next-generation security company that utilizes industry-leading unsupervised machine learning to detect fraudulent activity for financial transactions, mobile user acquisition, social networks, commerce, and money laundering. Our solution is used by some of the largest internet properties in the world, including Pinterest, FedEx, AirAsia, Synchrony Financial, Tokopedia, Zomato, and Ping An, to protect them from the ever-increasing risk of fraud.
DataVisor holds a rich product portfolio of AI as a platform and other SaaS products, such as feature platform, dEdge, rule engine, case management, and dCube. Our award-winning software is powered by a team of world-class experts in big data, security, and scalable infrastructure. Our culture is open, positive, collaborative, and results-driven. Come join us!
As complex fraud attacks become more prevalent, it is more important than ever to detect device manipulation by fraudesters. As an Android/IOS Security SDK Developer, you will work on SDK development to collect Androin/iOS operation system information and analysis abnormal behavior.

Title: AVP, Principal Product Engineer – Servicing Apps
Job_Description:
DataVisor is a next generation security company that utilizes industry leading unsupervised machine learning to detect fraudulent activity for financial transactions, mobile user acquisition, social networks, commerce, and money laundering. Our solution is used by some of the largest internet properties in the world, including Pinterest, AirAsia, Synchrony Financial, Tokopedia, Letgo, Zomato and Ping An, to protect them from the ever-increasing risk of fraud.
DataVisor holds a rich product portfolio of AI as a platform and other SaaS products, such as feature platform, dEdge, rule engine, case management and dCube. Our award-winning software is powered by a team of world-class experts in big data, security, and scalable infrastructure. Our culture is open, positive, collaborative, and results driven. Come join us!
Summary:
As platform engineers, we are building a next-generation machine learning platform, which incorporates our secret sauce, UML (unsupervised machine learning) with other SML (supervised machine learning) algorithms. Our team works to improve our core detection algorithms and automate the full training process.

ole Summary/Purpose:
Billions of transactions—and you’ll touch all of them if you join our IT team as a API Software Development Engineer - I. Imagine the sheer scale of what we impact every second of every day. Now imagine what you can do with that influence—this is where you can shape the future of payments.

As a API Software Development Engineer - I, you’ll be a part of an amazing team working on our microservice API’s throughout the entire development process. You’ll participate in hack-a-thons, partner with universities on innovation events, and work with our famed Stamford Innovation Station

Title: API Software Development Engineer - I
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
The AVP, Software Development Engineer Manager plays a pivotal technical role within Synchrony Financial in successfully hosting several client-facing platforms and delivering high-quality solutions.

This position is remote, where you have the option to work from home. Job_Description:

Title: API Software Development Engineer - I
Job_Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
The Endpoint Management Engineer will be responsible for leading a small team to manage Endpoint infrastructure, including the analysis, design, and implementation coordination as well as 3rd level escalation support of complex, enterprise level GPO-based solutions. Additionally, this role will be responsible to help drive Synchrony’s Modern Desktop Management and Internet Browser transformation.
The Endpoint Management Engineer will work within the Enterprise Client Computing organization, interacting with peer teams and partner groups, scaling, and deploying improvement, consolidation, and migration efforts within the enterprise. This role will operate and function well in a multi-cultural, geographically dispersed virtual team environment.
We’re proud to offer you choice and flexibility. You have the option to be remote, and work from home, or come into one of our offices. You may be occasionally requested to commute to our nearest office for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events.

As an API Software Development Engineer you’ll be developing API’s and leading an amazing team of engineers working on our API’s leveraging cloud technologies.

Title: API Software Development Engineer - I
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
The AVP, Information Security Engineer will be a key role in safeguarding the organizations systems, networks, and data in the cloud. The position is responsible for designing and building Cloud Security capabilities, management of these capabilities, and the supporting technology. In addition, this role will be responsible for acting as a trusted advisor for peers and other stakeholders within the organization.
We’re proud to offer you flexibility! This position is eligible to work remote, where you will work from home, and may require you to occasionally commute to one of our hubs for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events. Remote candidates will be considered who live near any Synchrony hub including: Alpharetta, GA, Chicago, IL, Costa Mesa, CA, Stamford, CT, New York, NY, Altamonte Springs, FL, Charlotte, NC, Dayton, OH, St. Paul, MN or Phoenix, AZ.
Information Technology

Title: API Software Development Engineer - I
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
The Identity Access Management (IAM) VP, Authentications Solutions is responsible for the design, development, implementation, application integration and improvement of Synchrony’s access management solutions including, but not limited to, Single Sign On & Federation, Directory Services, Multifactor and Authentication. Architecting these services to be robust and scalable supporting Synchrony’s employees, contractors, clients and customers. Lead a team of IAM engineers as the Okta platform and multi-factor authentication agile product owner.
This position is remote, where you have the option to work from home. On occasion we may request for you to commute to our nearest office for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events. To ensure the safety of our colleagues and communities, we require employees who come together in-person to be fully vaccinated. We’re proud to offer you choice and flexibility.

Information Technology

Title: API Software Development Engineer - I
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
The candidate Data Engineer will join an Agile scrum team and perform functional & system development for Synchrony’s Enterprise Data Lake.
As a Big Data Engineer the ability to integrate data across internal and external sources, provide analytical insights, and integrate with our critical systems are key skills. The engineer will participate in data analysis efforts to ensure the delivery of high-quality data ingestion, standardization and curation and maintain compliance with the applicable Data Sourcing, Data Quality, and Data Governance standards. The engineer will drive quality through the entire software development lifecycle with focus on functional requirements, efficiency, and methodology. The engineer will work cross-functionally with operations, other data engineers and product owner to assure capabilities are delivered that meet business needs.

Information Technology

Title: API Software Development Engineer - I
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
We are seeking a Technical Product Owner to lead our DNS and Edge servicing products within our connectivity organization. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, have experience working in a matrixed environment with technical engineering and development teams, strong project management and Agile skills with a focus on DNS and Edge products. The candidate should have a proven track record of delivering projects on time, within budget and with low business impact. This position will report to the VP, Connectivity Product Management Leader.
We’re proud to offer you choice and flexibility. You have the option to be remote, and work from home, or come into one of our offices. You may be occasionally requested to commute to our nearest office for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events.

Title: API Software Development Engineer - I
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
The VP, Privileged Access Lead Engineer will lead the engineering and delivery of monitoring and compliance detection solutions supporting the Identity and Access Management highly privileged account program. This role will lead the development of logging, monitoring and automation solutions across multiple platforms, including Active Directory, SailPoint, Applications, Database, Infrastructure and Cloud environments. This role must have strong communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to ensure the delivery of quality solutions while enforcing adherence to Synchrony’s Information Security policies and regulatory obligations.
We’re proud to offer you choice and flexibility. You have the option to be remote, and work from home, or come into one of our offices. You may be occasionally requested to commute to our nearest office for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events.

Title: API Software Development Engineer - I
Job_Description:
DataVisor is a next-generation security company that utilizes industry-leading unsupervised machine learning to detect fraudulent activity for financial transactions, mobile user acquisition, social networks, commerce and money laundering. Our solution is used by some of the largest Financial/Crypto sectorsin the world, including Visa, Synchrony Financial, Binance and Okcoin, to protect them from the ever-increasing risk of fraud. Our award-winning software is powered by a team of world-class experts in big data, security, and scalable infrastructure. Our culture is open, positive, collaborative, and results driven. Come join us!
As platform engineers, we are building a next-generation machine learning platform, which incorporates our secret sauce, UML (unsupervised machine learning) with other SML (supervised machine learning) algorithms. Our team works to improve our core detection algorithms and automate the full training process.
As complex fraud attacks become more prevalent, it is more important than ever to detect fraudsters in real-time. The platform team is responsible for developing the architecture that makes real-time UML possible. We are looking for creative and eager engineers to help us expand our novel streaming and database systems, which enable our detection capabilities.

Title: AVP, Credit Operations Modeling
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
Synchrony's Credit and Capital Management group is looking for a data scientist / credit risk modeling professional experienced with executing, maintaining and developing models under the relevant regulatory guidance (SR 11-7 / OCC 2011-12, CECL, CCAR, DFAST). This role is part of Credit and Capital Management, in the Reserves & Loss forecasting team. The role requires demonstrated expertise with data, statistical analysis and model development, as well as programming skills (Python/Pandas, Spark, Hadoop, SQL, Linux).
The primary focus of this role is on the quarterly reserve development process, as well as planning sessions involving loss forecast and reserve estimate projections. As lead analyst, the role is responsible for executing critical credit estimation models on a quarterly basis, providing analytical input to development of estimates of Credit and Fraud Losses by executing complex statistical, trend-based models with forward looking features.This role analyses trends and drivers of changes across the entire Synchrony portfolio and all products. In addition, robust collateral is required to be produced in support of process risk controls and related documentation as part of effective governance, as well as internal and external review.
Risk Management
